1.text: When therefore the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John

2.text: (although Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples),

3.text: he left Judea, and departed again into Galilee.

4.text: And he must needs pass through Samaria.

5.text: So he cometh to a city of Samaria, called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph:

6.text: and Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with his journey, sat thus by the well. It was about the sixth hour.

7.text: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her, Give me to drink.

8.text: For his disciples were gone away into the city to buy food.

9.text: The Samaritan woman therefore saith unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, who am a Samaritan woman? (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)

10.text: Jesus answered and said unto her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.

11.text: The woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: whence then hast thou that living water?

12.text: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his sons, and his cattle?

13.text: Jesus answered and said unto her, Every one that drinketh of this water shall thirst again:

14.text: but whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall become in him a well of water springing up unto eternal life.

15.text: The woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come all the way hither to draw.

16.text: Jesus saith unto her, Go, call thy husband, and come hither.

17.text: The woman answered and said unto him, I have no husband. Jesus saith unto her, Thou saidst well, I have no husband:

18.text: for thou hast had five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband: this hast thou said truly.

19.text: The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.

20.text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.

21.text: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when neither in this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, shall ye worship the Father.

22.text: Ye worship that which ye know not: we worship that which we know; for salvation is from the Jews.

23.text: But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and truth: for such doth the Father seek to be his worshippers.

24.text: God is a Spirit: and they that worship him must worship in spirit and truth.

25.text: The woman saith unto him, I know that Messiah cometh (he that is called Christ): when he is come, he will declare unto us all things.

26.text: Jesus saith unto her, I that speak unto thee am he.

27.text: And upon this came his disciples; and they marvelled that he was speaking with a woman; yet no man said, What seekest thou? or, Why speakest thou with her?

28.text: So the woman left her waterpot, and went away into the city, and saith to the people,

29.text: Come, see a man, who told me all things that ever I did: can this be the Christ?

30.text: They went out of the city, and were coming to him.

31.text: In the mean while the disciples prayed him, saying, Rabbi, eat.

32.text: But he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not.

33.text: The disciples therefore said one to another, Hath any man brought him aught to eat?

34.text: Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to accomplish his work.

35.text: Say not ye, There are yet four months, and then cometh the harvest? behold, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields, that they are white already unto harvest.

36.text: He that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto life eternal; that he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.

37.text: For herein is the saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.

38.text: I sent you to reap that whereon ye have not labored: others have labored, and ye are entered into their labor.

39.text: And from that city many of the Samaritans believed on him because of the word of the woman, who testified, He told me all things that ever I did.

40.text: So when the Samaritans came unto him, they besought him to abide with them: and he abode there two days.

41.text: And many more believed because of his word;

42.text: and they said to the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy speaking: for we have heard for ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Saviour of the world.

43.text: And after the two days he went forth from thence into Galilee.

44.text: For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honor in his own country.

45.text: So when he came into Galilee, the Galilæans received him, having seen all the things that he did in Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.

46.text: He came therefore again unto Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.

47.text: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judæa into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son; for he was at the point of death.

48.text: Jesus therefore said unto him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will in no wise believe.

49.text: The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.

50.text: Jesus saith unto him, Go thy way; thy son liveth. The man believed the word that Jesus spake unto him, and he went his way.

51.text: And as he was now going down, his servants met him, saying, that his son lived.

52.text: So he inquired of them the hour when he began to amend. They said therefore unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.

53.text: So the father knew that it was at that hour in which Jesus said unto him, Thy son liveth: and himself believed, and his whole house.

54.text: This is again the second sign that Jesus did, having come out of Judæa into Galilee.
